page.title: 05WILDLIFE IN THE FOREST
page.content: On 27th June 1985 some children went birdwatching with a man from the{Royal {Society for the Protection of Birds. The footpath we went down was off the {Balcombe Road}opposite a private road called{Whitley Hill.}The footpath is fenced off from the private woodland. It was very quiet and peaceful and every time we saw or heard a bird the man from the{R.S.P.B.}told us a bit about it.We saw:{Nuthatch, Chaffinch, {Bluetit, yellow-hammer,Willow-warbler, {Swift,Robin, Hobby, Wood-pigeon, wren. Then we looked at things like fungi, insects and plants.This is what we saw:{Grasshoppers, Tiger beetles, {crickets,Gold beetle,Froghopper.}We saw{Yellow bracket fungi}on a{yew tree and a{pollarded beech tree.}The pollarded trees are very old. The wood was once used for{charcoal burning}for the{iron ore industry
